# Copilot instructions for this repository

## General
- Prefer academic, in-depth changes when making edits.
- Preserve existing formatting, headings, and file organization.
- Prefer ASCII unless a file already uses non-ASCII characters.
- Avoid adding or modifying binary files.

## Content conventions
- Match the existing tone, terminology, and language in each file.
- Default to English unless a file already uses another language.
- Preserve existing naming, date, and citation formats; do not introduce new styles.
- Keep lists, tables, and front matter aligned with local patterns.
- Avoid rewriting or paraphrasing content unless explicitly requested.

## Documentation style
- Prefer Markdown for new text files.
- Use short, descriptive headings and consistent bullet styles.
- Keep links relative within the repository when possible.

## Repository hygiene
- Do not rename or move folders without an explicit request.
- Do not delete content unless explicitly asked.
- Ask for clarification before making broad or sweeping changes.
